Description: Circular black steatite votive patera; inside is a relief representation of Harpocrates seated upon the back of a goose with papyrus plants behind; rosette on the underside; rim chipped.
Curator's comments: For corpus, cf. Louvre MA 2734; Ashmolean 1891.432 (Chester Qena), 1891.501 (Chester), 1891.546 (Chester), 1932.661, 1941.1250, 1941.1251 (both acq. Luxor 1907); BM EA 32255 (Chester), 36135 (Chester), 38511 (Chester), 38512 (Hay), 38513 (Cureton), 38514 (Chester), 38515 (Chester), 38516 (unknown), 38517 (Chester), 64024, 69181-82 (both transferred from V&A, acq. 'Wallis?').
Bibliographic references: Evans 1908 / Thursday, 13th February, 1908. Sir John Evans Read the Following Notes on Some Vessels of Steatite from Egypt (p.94-97, fig.8)
